definition: non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
Mt Wuyi in Fujian/Wuyishan nature reserve/Wuyishan county level city in Nanping 南平[Nan2 ping2] Fujian
to level/to raze to the ground
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
Wuyishan county level city in Nanping 南平[Nan2 ping2] Fujian
Yiling district of Yichang city 宜昌市[Yi2 chang1 shi4], Hubei
to level/to raze to the ground
common term for non-Han peoples in former times, not exclusively derogatory/barbarian

Yiling (barbarian mound), historical place name in Yichang county 宜昌縣|宜昌县 Hubei, first mentioned in history (after its destruction by Qin) as burial place of the former Chu kings/Yiling district of Yichang city 宜昌市[Yi2 chang1 shi4], Hubei
Eastern Barbarians, non-Han tribe living to the east of China c 2200 BC

to use foreigners to subdue foreigners (idiom); let the barbarians fight it out among themselves (traditional policy of successive dynasties)/Use Western science and technology to counter imperialist encroachment. (late Qing modernizing slogan)

sentences.english: If you don't pay, I will reduce your abode to debris.
sentences.chinese: 否則的話，我會把你的屋子夷爲廢城。

sentences.english: "Barbarian" is the Chinese people on behalf of the Central Plains culture of non-denial and contempt.
sentences.chinese: “夷”代表的是國人對非中原文化的否認與輕視。

sentences.english: The foreign editions of Eragon continue to pour in.
sentences.chinese: 國外版本的夷儒公漫畫也不斷寄來了。

sentences.english: YiJianZhi is the largest collection of ghost stories in Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《夷堅志》是宋代規模最大的志怪小說集。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter, " Yi Jian Zhi " to "Chinese Dictionary" added.
sentences.chinese: 第四章論述《夷堅志》對《漢語大詞典》的補充。

sentences.english: The bombing raid practically leveled the town.
sentences.chinese: 空襲幾乎把這座城鎮夷爲高山。

sentences.english: In the past a tribal native east of China really admired the rites of China.
sentences.chinese: 以前東方有個夷人，他很仰慕華夏文明的禮法。

sentences.english: Several days ago, North Korea warned it may turn the South into a "sea of ashes."
sentences.chinese: 幾天前，北韓警告說，它可以把韓國夷爲焦土。

sentences.english: May the Blessed One remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.
sentences.chinese: 願薄伽梵記得我這個從今日起一生歸依於他的優婆夷。

sentences.english: If you don't pay, I will reduce your house to debris.
sentences.chinese: 否則的話，我會把你的房子夷爲廢城。

sentences.english: Hawaii is one of the most beautiful places in the world.
sentences.chinese: 夏成夷是世界上最美的地方之一。

definition: prisoner of war/to capture/to take prisoner/(old) northern barbarian/slave
common term for non-Han peoples in former times, not exclusively derogatory/barbarian
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Eastern Barbarians, non-Han tribe living to the east of China c 2200 BC
